form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Cardin (for himself and Ms. Collins) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to exclude from gross income amounts received on account of claims based on certain unlawful discrimination and to allow income averaging for backpay and frontpay awards received on account of such claims, and for other purposes.

section.text:
This Act may be cited as the
Civil Justice Tax Fairness Act of 2013 .

section.header: Exclusion from gross income for amounts received on account of certain unlawful discrimination

subsection.text: Part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (relating to items specifically excluded from gross income) is amended by inserting before section 140 the following new section:

section.header: Amounts received on account of certain unlawful discrimination

paragraph.text: Gross income does not include amounts received by a claimant (whether by judgment or settlement and whether as lump sums or periodic payments) on account of a claim of unlawful discrimination.
For purposes of paragraph (1), the term amounts does not include—

subparagraph.text: backpay or frontpay, as defined in section 1302(b), or

subsection.text: For purposes of this section, the term unlawful discrimination has the meaning given such term by section 62(e).
The table of sections for part III of subchapter B of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting before the item relating to section 140 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 139E. Amounts received on account of certain unlawful discrimination.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts received in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.

section.header: Limitation on tax based on income averaging for backpay and frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment discrimination
Income from backpay and frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment discrimination

subsection.text: If employment discrimination backpay or frontpay is received by a taxpayer during a taxable year, the tax imposed by this chapter for such taxable year shall not exceed the sum of—

paragraph.text: the tax which would be so imposed if—

subparagraph.text: no amount of such backpay or frontpay were included in gross income for such year, and

no deduction were allowed for such year for expenses (otherwise allowable as a deduction to the taxpayer for such year) in connection with making or prosecuting any claim of unlawful employment discrimination by or on behalf of the taxpayer, plus
the number of years in the backpay period and frontpay period, and
the amount by which the tax determined under paragraph (1) would increase if the amount on which such tax is determined were increased by the average annual net backpay and frontpay amount.

paragraph.text: The term employment discrimination backpay or frontpay means backpay or frontpay receivable (whether as lump sums or periodic payments) on account of a claim of unlawful employment discrimination.
The term unlawful employment discrimination has the meaning provided the term unlawful discrimination in section 62(e).
The terms backpay and frontpay mean amounts—

subparagraph.text: which are includible in gross income in the taxable year as compensation which is attributable—

clause.text: in the case of backpay, to services performed, or that would have been performed but for a claimed violation of law, as an employee, former employee, or prospective employee before such taxable year for the taxpayer’s employer, former employer, or prospective employer, and
in the case of frontpay, to employment that would have been performed but for a claimed violation of law, in a taxable year or taxable years following the taxable year, and

subparagraph.text: which are received on account of a judgment or settlement resulting from a claim for a violation of law.

paragraph.text: The term backpay period means the period during which services are performed (or would have been performed) to which backpay is attributable. If such period is not equal to a whole number of taxable years, such period shall be increased to the next highest number of whole taxable years.

The term frontpay period means the period of foregone employment to which frontpay is attributable. If such period is not equal to a whole number of taxable years, such period shall be increased to the next highest number of whole taxable years.

paragraph.header: Average annual net backpay and frontpay amount
paragraph.text: The term average annual net backpay and frontpay amount means the amount equal to—

clause.text: employment discrimination backpay and frontpay, over
the amount of deductions that would have been allowable but for subsection (a)(1)(B), divided by

subparagraph.text: the number of years in the backpay period and frontpay period.

subsection.text: The table of sections for part I of subchapter Q of chapter 1 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by inserting after section 1301 the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: Sec. 1302. Income from backpay and frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment discrimination.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to amounts received in taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.

section.header: Income averaging for backpay and frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment discrimination not to increase alternative minimum tax liability

subsection.text: Section 55(c) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 (defining regular tax) is amended by redesignating paragraph (3) as paragraph (4) and by inserting after paragraph (2) the following:

paragraph.header: Coordination with income averaging for amounts received on account of employment discrimination
paragraph.text: Solely for purposes of this section, section 1302 (relating to averaging of income from backpay or frontpay received on account of certain unlawful employment discrimination) shall not apply in computing the regular tax.

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2012.
